title: Input and Output Basics (System.out, Scanner intro)

questions.question: Which method prints text and moves to the next line?
questions.explanation: System.out.println() prints text and automatically moves the cursor to the next line.

questions.question: Which method prints text without moving to the next line?
questions.explanation: System.out.print() prints text without adding a newline, allowing subsequent output on the same line.

questions.question: What import statement is needed to use Scanner?
questions.explanation: Scanner is located in the java.util package, so you need: import java.util.Scanner;

questions.question: How do you create a Scanner for keyboard input?
questions.explanation: System.in represents keyboard input, so you create: Scanner input = new Scanner(System.in);

questions.question: Which Scanner method reads an entire line of text?
questions.explanation: nextLine() reads an entire line of text, including spaces, until the user presses Enter.

questions.question: Which Scanner method reads only the next word?
questions.explanation: next() reads the next word (token), stopping at whitespace like spaces or tabs.

questions.question: Which Scanner method reads an integer?
questions.explanation: nextInt() reads the next integer value from the input stream.
print() doesn't add newlines, so both strings appear on the same line: "Hello World!"

questions.question: Which Scanner method reads a decimal number?
questions.explanation: nextDouble() reads decimal numbers (floating-point values) from the input.

questions.question: What combines text and variables in output?
questions.explanation: The + operator concatenates strings and converts variables to strings for display.

questions.question: Which Scanner method reads true/false values?
questions.explanation: nextBoolean() reads boolean values (true or false) from the input.

questions.question: What should you do after nextInt() before using nextLine()?

options.value: Call nextLine() to consume the newline

questions.explanation: After nextInt(), call nextLine() to consume the remaining newline character before reading text.

questions.question: What does System.out.println(5 + 3) display?
questions.explanation: The expression 5 + 3 is evaluated first, resulting in 8, which is then displayed.

questions.question: What's a good practice when finished with a Scanner?
questions.explanation: It's good practice to call close() on Scanner objects when finished to free system resources.

questions.question: What does "Enter your age: " represent in a program?
questions.explanation: "Enter your age: " is a user prompt that tells the user what type of input is expected.

questions.question: What does this create: Scanner input = new Scanner(System.in);
questions.explanation: This creates a Scanner object that reads input from the keyboard (System.in).
